result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Per contact w/State and counsel, HE set 11-7-22 at 3:30pm to review competency of def; notice sent
References Examining psychologist's report filed 10/26/22
Received from Danielle Calas, Psy.D. (Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed on 10/26/22)

Defendant Leon A Murdo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Leon A Murdo.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr's report reviewed and is not contested.   State requests court adopt the doctors report and for this case to be scheduled for a future hearing to track defendants progress. Defense doesn't contest the report;  Court adjourns this case day to day pending additional report from department as to restoring defendants competency.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Mendota for hearing on 10-14-22

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leon A Murdo in court, in custody.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Leon A Murdo. Counsel's first appearance. Competency report rec'd; no objections noted.  Court finds def not competent but likely to become competent and orders def committed for treatment.  Court orders def into custody of Sheriff pending placement; Sheriff to transport def to institution identified by DHS.  Case 22CM416 to tag.
from Dr Goebel; Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed 5-2-22
References report from Dr Goebel filed 5-2-22
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney; attempted - not known
(copy mailed to Atty. Nelson & defendant)
Per direction of Court, Atty Nelson to be appointed as counsel; repayment TBD - order completed.
Letter received from Atty de Junco
to DA via efile, emailed to DHS, mailed to def and Sheriff
(Defendant refused to sign)

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leon A Murdo appeared by video, in custody.  Def consents to appearing by video.  SPD was unable to determine if def is eligible for their services.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def motions to dismiss; Court denies motion. Def referred to SPD; Atty de Junco indicates he will interview def at the jail.  Court sets $3000 cash bond. Court finds competency to be an issue and orders evaluation to be completed.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
